metadata.title: CVE-2021-34556 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel through 5.13.7, an unprivileged BPF program can obtainsensitive information from kernel memory via a Speculative Store Bypassside-channel attack because the protection mechanism neglects thepossibility of uninitialized memory locations on the BPF stack.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
